abstract: Russian Supreme Court dismisses government lawsuit aimed at shutting down human rights advocacy group Memorial; group has been investigating civil rights violations in Soviet era and contemporary Russia.
lead_paragraph: Russia’s Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a government effort to shut down Memorial, the country’s oldest human rights advocacy group.
snippet: Russia’s Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a government effort to shut down Memorial, the country’s oldest human rights advocacy group.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Russia: Court Rules for Rights Group
headline.print_headline: Russia: Court Rules for Rights Group
